But across the rest of 2023, PogaÄar always had the edge over him in one-day racing and at Paris-Nice.

Theirs is a thrilling rivalry to watch and it would certainly be ideal for fans to see them go head-to-head for more than three weeks of the year â€“ but whether Vingegaard agrees is a different question.

Beyond demonstrating that thereâ€™s more to road racing than just three weeks in July, PogaÄarâ€™s decision puts him in an elite bracket of riders to contest so many of cyclingâ€™s toughest races in one year.
